company_updates_collection.reshared_post_author_headline: Professor, Mathematics Education, Stanford University, co-founder of youcubed.org, Struggly
company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description: I recently cofounded a maths app, to share creative, beautiful mathematics, and encourage students to feel good about struggle, it is called Struggly! We're currently working on a new teacher dashboard that launches in August, and this video gives a sneak peek. You can access Struggly here:  https://lnkd.in/gsVNjU2d

company_updates_collection.description:
This picture says more than a thousand words could – it is high time to disrupt the EdTech school market.
#school #edtech 
Tanya LaMar Dr Jo Boaler Cathy Williams Björn Münker Daniel DöbertinJochen Schlaier Marco Zingler Florian Schimmer Christian von Reventlow Christoph Faschian

We are working on a new modern interface for teachers, coaches, and administrators. This is our prototype on which we are finalizing the UX and tweaking the responsive layout. Teachers will be able to conveniently do the most essential functions on their mobile phones. #teachers #ux 

Tanya LaMar Björn Münker Daniel Döbertin Alina Schlaier

🏆 🏆 🏆 We have received several awards lately—most of them for User Experience, User Interface, and Technical Achievements/Innovation. 
All thanks to the great team Tanya LaMar, Dr Jo Boaler, Björn Münker, Daniel Döbertin, Alina Schlaier. Also, a big thank you to Jochen Schlaier, Marco Zingler, Christian von Reventlow, Florian Schimmer, Christoph Faschian, Peggy Shirin Möller, Anne Pellenz, Samuel Weiß, Til Andressen, Alexander Mitzkus
We won the impactful German DDA Best-of-Show-Award - W&V, Werben & Verkaufen tells our story 🍾
company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description: Sie räumte beim Deutschen Digital Award ab – die Mathe-Lernplattform Struggly, die Denkwerk mit Stanford-Wissenschaftlerinnen entwickelte. Wir zeigen, wie die App entstand, die durch außergewöhnliches UX-Design hervorsticht.

company_updates_collection.description:
Struggly wins at #dda23 "Best of 2023" 3 x gold 🥇, 1 x bronze 🥉 
Thank you to the jury who let their children play Struggly. And they couldn't stop playing. That's the toughest test a product has to pass
company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
„Wir haben Struggly in der Jury mega gefeiert.“ (Anke Herbener, Jurymitglied Deutscher Digital Award 2023)
Die Mathe-App Struggly von Boggl Inc. und denkwerk begeistert beim #dda23: 3 x Gold 🥇, 1 x Bronze 🥉 – und als Bonus die Auszeichnung „Best of 2023“! Was die Jury an Struggly so fasziniert hat? Das erzählen wir euch im denkwerk Blog: https://lnkd.in/e7SE6bqm 🚀
 
#createpositivechange #dda23 #mathe #award #struggly Struggly Bundesverband Digitale Wirtschaft (BVDW) e.V.

It was a fantastic night. Struggly won eight Red Dot awards, seven of them for Animation, UI, UX, Illustration, etc. And one Best of the Best for Branding. The award ceremony was held in the beautiful Berlin Konzerthaus.
 Dr Jo Boaler Tanya LaMar Björn Münker Daniel Döbertin Bart Claessens Jochen Schlaier Marco Zingler

And Luke Thomas Alan Louie Michael Carter

🚀  Struggly Presents: Free Webinar for Educators!  🚀

How a math task is launched shapes how students engage with it. A great task launch sparks curiosity, invites student thinking, and sets the stage for deep mathematical exploration. But how we launch matters!

Join us for this month’s Struggly Presents Webinar, "It's all in the Launch: Strategies for Launching Rich Math Tasks," where we’ll explore powerful strategies to get tasks started in ways that empower students as sense-makers.
We’re thrilled to be joined by Michele Benedetti, Struggly Ambassador and coach for the Campbell Union School District. Together we will explore three essential task launch styles:
🔹 Notice & Wonder
🔹 Student Exploration
🔹 Learning Keys

Even better—we’ll watch classroom video of Michele launching a task with 5th graders in real time! Plus, you’ll get to experience a few tasks yourself—because the best way to learn is to play. Don’t miss this free professional learning opportunity! 

Register now: [ https://lnkd.in/gGj7Xiab ]

Keeping students engaged in math while building deep conceptual understanding is a challenge many schools and districts face. We invite you to a fireside chat with Dr Jo Boaler, Cathy Williams, and district leaders to explore how K-8 schools and districts are implementing Struggly to help students embrace productive struggle, persist in problem-solving, and build deep mathematical thinking.
 
✨ Math, Mindsets & Meaningful Change: A Fireside Chat with Jo Boaler ✨
📅 Tuesday, March 11, 2025 | 3:30 PM PT
📍 Register Here: [tinyurl.com/47we22bu]
 
In this conversation, Jo Boaler (Stanford researcher & math education expert), Cathy Williams (Youcubed co-founder), Dewey Gottlieb (Hawaii DOE), and Rea Smith (Rogers Public Schools) will share insights on:

Engagement & Persistence – How to help students embrace struggle as part of learning and develop perseverance in problem-solving

Conceptual Understanding – Strategies for strengthening students’ reasoning and deepening their understanding of grade-level content

District Implementation – How leaders are successfully bringing Struggly into classrooms and what they’ve learned in the process

We hope to see you there on Tuesday!

We are excited to share this upcoming fireside chat on math, mindsets, and meaningful change with our co-founder Dr Jo Boaler plus Cathy Williams and district leaders dewey gottlieb (Hawaii DOE) & Rea Smith (Rogers Public Schools)! We’ll be diving into how district leaders can support teachers in helping students embrace struggle, build deep mathematical thinking, and shift math instruction—all using rich tasks through Struggly.

If you’re a school or district leader thinking about how to bring research-backed math learning to your students, this is a conversation you won’t want to miss! Hope to see you there.

📅 [March 11th, 2025 @ 3:30pm PT]
📍 [Registration Link: https://lnkd.in/gUKNVQja]
